fr:mainmatter.fr:p: For all k, the filtration F on \operatorname {H}^k(K_\mathbb {C})\simeq \operatorname {H}^k(K_A)\otimes \mathbb {C} defines a Hodge A-structure of weight n+k on \operatorname {H}^k(K_A), i.e. the filtration F is (n+k)-opposite to its complex conjugate (which makes sense, since A\subset \mathbb {R}).

The following axioms have to be satisfied:
1267Axiomhodge-theory-iii-8.1-ch1hodge-theory-iii-8.1-ch1.xmlCH1hodge-theory-iii-8.1.1
The differential d of K_\mathbb {C} is strictly compatible with the filtration F; in other words, the spectral sequence defined by (K_\mathbb {C},F) degenerates at E_1 (i.e. E_1=E_\infty ) .
